website_summaries.verdict: The Mountain Light II is a heritage piece from Danner which has proven its worth over time. This backpacking boot did not fail to amaze outdoor lovers. Its comfort and decade-worth of service were exceptional. The boot may be handcrafted, but its artistry remained incomparable.On the flipside, the outwardly quintessential pair was criticized for its narrow fit. Finally, it may be concluded that the Danner Mountain Light II is a cut-above-the-rest boot, yet those who want a pair must be willing to make some interventions.
pros: More than a handful of brand enthusiasts were dumbfounded with the durability of these vintage-inspired backpacking boots
Numerous users expressed how comfortable the Mountain Light II feels on foot
The craftsmanship of the Mountain Light II was first-rate, according to a lot of hikers
A majority of purchasers were impressed with how the boots surpassed their expectations
The outsole offered a reliable amount of traction on trails, based on some user reviews
A large number of wearers loved the fact that this boot can be recrafted
Considering the boot’s useful lifetime and ultra-expensive price, heaps of buyers noted that this was one of their best investments ever
Several owners liked how the backpacking footgear kept their feet dry after crossing streams
The functionality of Danner’s second iteration of the Mountain Light left plenty of wearers at a loss for words
They wore it from town to the trails with sheer delight
After finding out that their Mountain Light IIs were made locally (in the United States), a few verified purchasers couldn’t help but express satisfaction
cons: Some buyers wished that the Mountain Light II offered more ankle support
The tongue of the Mountain Light II took a lot of getting used to based on a considerable number of consumer reviews
According to a handful of users, this backpacking boot was too narrow, especially in the toe area
A couple of hiking aficionados found the boots to be heavy
To get the most out of the Mountain Light II from Danner, a significant amount of break-in time was necessary, according to a small group of backpackers

customer_reviews.title: Excellent boots. Better than the Irish Setters they replaced
customer_reviews.text: Excellent boots. Better than the Irish Setters they replaced. Thank you Danner for making quality boots that don't rely on miracle glue to hold the soles on. Break-in was a non-event. To me the one-piece upper is key. I have a narrow foot with relatively long toes. the one-piece upper allows the boot to bend in the right place for my foot, unrestricted by any seam. They run narrow, the regular fits like my old B width, but I read that in other reviews, so I ordered a regular width and it fits well.
customer_reviews.author: Muddy Fingers

customer_reviews.title: Title is incorrect, they are Not women's boots
customer_reviews.text: Looking at the size chart, I figured out that they were Men's boots, which is what I wanted. I ordered a half size smaller as suggested by others. That worked. When they arrived, I thought they may have been used. No insoles in either boot. I searched Danner blogs and found that their GORE-TEX lined boots don't have insoles. It affects the function of the GORE-TEX. What the ? I want insole. I have ordered some and am currently waiting for them to come in. Hurry up Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Icabodcrane

customer_reviews.title: Most Excellent Boot
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fit and finish, tongue was a little "different" in the way its made/designed, has a lot of material on the Arch of Foot. First pair had a defect in the tongue area, was immediately replaced. Vibram Soles are the BEST. Sprayed on Silicon Spray liberally, let soak in then treated with Lanolin Horse Harness Cream and cleaner, for break-in. Plastic Insoles are OK, will try them, very comfortable boot, good fit, excellent hold and comfort. Highly recommend if you are looking for a medium weight boot, that is work tough.
customer_reviews.author: MiMo

customer_reviews.title: Yeah definitely, good stuff!
customer_reviews.text: Seriously really sweet. Nice cushion action, they lace up nice and don't weigh a ton. I see some cats here saying they're just not sturdy enough for whatever kind of Mt Everest excursion they're pretending to have, these things are plenty sturdy for outdoor action, but light enough and comfy enough to stomp on hippies and the local public house. You should have a set of these, seriously, get them.
customer_reviews.author: C. Biscuit

customer_reviews.title: Genuine Item
customer_reviews.text: Be wary when wearing the shoes for the first time. The lip is memory foam and will mold to your foot. For me, these shoes are good to go right out of the box. You will probably want to get wide foot if you planning on putting an insoles in this shoe. However I have no problem wearing the shoes without any insoles. With that being said, you may want to go with wide toe as it is easier to get thicker socks than to force the shoe to fit your feet. That being said, the lip was squeaky. I musta had a defect. But after one cleaning and conditioning, the noise dramatically faded.
customer_reviews.author: Malise

customer_reviews.title: No liner on inside of boot to speak of, rivets will cut into the toes for any serious hiking more than up the mall escalators.
customer_reviews.text: No liner on inside of boot to speak of, rivets will cut into the toes for any serious hiking more than up the mall escalators. Do not buy this boot if you plan to hike more than from the car to the mall. It does however, look cool and you will look cool around town and on Facebook. Especially since it was featured in 007 movies. I expected more out of a boot over $100. This one should sell in the $50 range.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: Great So Far
customer_reviews.text: Caveat - 3 or so weeks of non-mountain walking - will update if need be after I return from the Cascades. Initial break in was about ten days of wearing/walking, for me. One blister on my Achilles and initial pain on the blunt end of my tibia. The tibia no longer experiences any discomfort (unlike an Italian Made pair of LLBean hikers I wore for several years). My feet are totally comfortable and not too warm on a July Chicagoland day. The tongue stays in the middle of the boot, another problem many other hiking boots experience. They look great, feel great and will hopefully equal the pair I wore from 1991 to 2001. These boots look good, classic!
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Ketter

customer_reviews.title: I had expected a better quality hardware
customer_reviews.text: I have been slowly breaking the boots in and as well as my feet. I have not worn them a lot and not through any rough dirt, muddy terrain. They have gotten wet with snow melting on them. I am bit dissatisfied that the tabs which hold the D rings are rusting and staining the leather, I had expected a better quality hardware. My boots are black and may have not been noticed on the dark brown boots. If this worsens I will return them. Based on reviews and recommendations I would expect these boots to last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: RLS

customer_reviews.title: Excellent boot - Suggest reading Other reviews regarding size ordering.
customer_reviews.text: 1st off, excellent boot, construction great. Can see these providing good service. I do recommend the sizing suggestions found on the other reviews. Very helpful and saved me a return. I typically wear a 12 D. Other reviews recommend to go the EE for width citing the D is found to be narrow. I stuck with the 12 and found this posed no issue with the appropriate room shoe fit wise. I additionally ordered the "Superio Snow Ice Cleats Snow Grips" for added grip, however, those have not arrived at this writing.
customer_reviews.author: DustOff

customer_reviews.title: Get an Italian made boot. (wish I could say otherwise).
customer_reviews.text: The boots are uncomfortable, very tight on the Achilles tendon, and the toe box is too small. The Gortex lining feels lumpy and wavey on the footbed, annoying. They don't lie flat and are unstable. The plastic heel insert seems intended to compensate for the poor design. I put in 48 miles, thinking that they would break in, nope. I bought a shoe stretcher, which helped. I still don't feel good about the purchase. Too bad as I like the retro look and wanted to support a US-made company. I have Italian boots (Zamberlan); they are far superior. The Italians are the best at shoe and boot design. They are craftsmen and understand the foot.
customer_reviews.author: John Peyton

customer_reviews.title: Only bad thing is that I wish I would have bought them sooner.
customer_reviews.text: The boots took about two 5 mile hikes to break in as well as some quality leather conditioner. After the initial break in period, which was a bit painful on the achilles, I have never worn a more comfortable pair of boots (maybe even shoes) in my years. I was worried about the narrow last in a size 15 boot, because I normally buy wides if I can find them in my size, but alas; it is more nimble on the trail and my feet do not feel cramped. Thank you for making a quality made in USA product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lawrence

customer_reviews.title: Painful if you wear them for hiking!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these several months in advance hoping I could break them in for a rim to rim Grand Canyon hike this fall. The Danners look nice and I love that they're USA made but I've logged dozens of miles in them and have nothing to show for it besides blistered, painful feet. The soles are wrinkled up and uncomfortable on my heels and one boot cuts up my Achilles every time even though I only wear high-end hiking socks with them. All things considered this was a tremendous waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Drew W

customer_reviews.title: Fitting Fear Factor Follies
customer_reviews.text: I comfortably wear 9 1/2 D boots in Caterpillar, Corcoran, Chippewa, Doc Martin, and Carolina. So, imagine my trepidation when the Danner chart at the top of the page said my foot length translated to *8 1/2*. Hmmmm. I ordered the smaller size with quite a bit of concern but couldn't be happier with the result. The actual length of the boot is identical to each of those other brands. My toes have room to flex and don't feel constrained. My heel is held comfortably and has no slippage. In short, the chart was right. Go figure.
customer_reviews.author: Marshall Mac

customer_reviews.title: Best boots yet!  Very comfortable!  They run narrow (so order accordingly) but are designed to fit like a glove!
customer_reviews.text: Great boots. Note, they run narrow naturally and by design. Order accordingly. Note: Danners do NOT include an insole, also by design. So don't be alarmed when they show up. They come with a plastic heel cup quasi-orthotic, but nothing else. Don't worry, they are so comfortable, you don't need an insole. Like any high quality leather boot, they require a period of break-in. Buy the Danner boot dressing to accelerate that process.
customer_reviews.author: Tate3441

customer_reviews.title: Great boots ! Made in the USA !
customer_reviews.text: Normally wear 10.5, 10.5 fit too loose, Went down half size, Fits just right
customer_reviews.author: Vetteman07

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: I work for the post office and I was getting tired of waterproofing wearing off in the middle of winter. A friend recommended these to me and I have to say I have still worn them every day halfway into the summer now. The break in time on these boots is the only downfall but I have to say that it has been well worth it. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: M. Webster

customer_reviews.title: They are very comfortable, but I am disappointed with the quality
customer_reviews.text: In less than a year I had a huge hole in the right toe and the side has a 3” rip where it tore free from the sole. I had a pair of rainforest boots that lasted for 20 years, but these boots or not built for longevity. They are very comfortable, but I am disappointed with the quality. I missed the one year warranty window. Wish Danner would back it up.
customer_reviews.author: Will S.

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Have been a loyal Danner customer since 1993. The leather on these boots was surprisingly thin—an inferior grade of cowhide, The fit was also poor—small and uncomfortable. For almost $400, comfort and quality should be much better. Hope this was an anomaly. Returning for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: J. Wood

customer_reviews.title: Poor lace and eyelet design makes it difficult to acheive best fit
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed in the lace/eyelet design of this boot. Boot is long and narrow and must really be cinched down over the toes and bridge of the foot to fit well, but the eyelet design does not allow the stock laces to be cinched and remain that way when looping the laces around the hooks to secure the boot. My boot size is a 14 so the length of my boot may be the issue - smaller sizes may not have the same problem. Boot is lighter in weight and shorter in the ankle than I prefer...wish I had purchased the Merrill Wilderness instead and looking forward to getting back into Limmers.
customer_reviews.author: M. Tarr

customer_reviews.title: Great USA made boot!!
customer_reviews.text: Great USA made boot! Three years and fits like the day after they were broken in. The soles wear a little faster than others, but they are overall the best investment for a multiple day, mountain backpack trip. Sending them to Danner for a resole for $115. I was a Vasque wearer before but their products are all made in China now the soles literally broke off in chunks on the first 10 miles breaking them in, not like the product in the 90's. Buy Danners!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Daysend

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Boot
customer_reviews.text: Danner makes one of the best boots out there and this model lives up to that reputation. These are built on the 650 last which does run on the narrow side. I wear a narrow width in several shoes/boots and these fit me good in the d width. If your foot is on the more wide side of medium you will probably need the ee width.
customer_reviews.author: SRC

customer_reviews.title: Mixed feelings, size issues.
customer_reviews.text: Overall seems to be high quality boot, would love to keep, however have to return both 9EE and 9.5EE. My true size is 9.5E. The 9.5EE were just too big, the 9EE seemed OK, however the heel was not secured at all, it felt like I'm wearing some sort of flip flops as it was freely moving up/down. I'm not sure if 9D would make it. For now I'm skipping on this model and would probably try something else...
customer_reviews.author: Slava

customer_reviews.title: Great boot for $280
customer_reviews.text: Mine came with the plastic heel support. Boot fits great. Love it. No blisters yet. The fit was different than expected. Not bad. Just different. The soles are a little narrow. Especially around my foot arch. A little awkward at first. The Vibram sole is twice as thick as a traditional Vibram sole. It has this weird soft stuff in the middle. Makes the boot feel high off the ground. This makes my balance feel off. This I don't like.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Great American Boots
customer_reviews.text: I have a pair of Danners that are over 20 yrs old and believe in the quality of this American Company. It does take time for them to break in but once they are you will have a pair of boots that will outlast any other product around. Having them resoled is simple and cheap. I bought these because my old ones are a little heavy for hiking though I have done 300-400 miles on the AT with them.
customer_reviews.author: David Thacker

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Danner Boot - -Order up in width
customer_reviews.text: The Mountain Light II, per Danner’s website, is a narrower designed boot. I’m a 12.5 D and originally ordered it to size but it was too narrow. Sent them back and ordered 12.5 EE and they’re absolutely perfect. If you’re a D order the EE and save yourself the hassle of having to send them back. Other than that...length is accurate, quality, and the Danner reputation is all there!
customer_reviews.author: Bonesman

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic boots
customer_reviews.text: If you are looking for a comfortable and versatile hiking boot, these are perfect. I bought them in 9.5 2E and they fit me very well. As with all shoes of this type, there is a long break in time, but you can’t get a boot of the same quality that doesn’t need to be broken in. Massage the leather and wear them often; they’ll begin to fit you like a glove in no time. I’ve been wearing them for a week and I love them, but I’ll edit this review in the future with details on their long term performance
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: True to size, durable construction
customer_reviews.text: Got these to replace my first pair of Mountain Lights I bought 25 years ago. I have a wide foot and these EE's fit perfectly. They do require a lot break-in time, but worth the effort. I am having a little trouble with an inside seam that is putting pressure on one foot. Hopefully, the break-in will fix that.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Danner Mountain Lite II boots
customer_reviews.text: Awesome boots! The quality is very high,stitching is flawless,leather is soft.Wore them for a few days before they felt really,really good.I looked for awhile for a boot with old-school quality.Stiched,not glued,soft leather,and light. These Danner Boots are made in the USA,Portland Oregon.Not imported. Expensive,yes.But,they will last many years.I have had some so called hi end boots,imported,glued together.And they did not last more than a couple years.I have a pair of Danner boots,taller,heavier,I have had for 20 years,and not a stitch has broken. AAAAA+++++
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Well made but sized wrong for a hiker
customer_reviews.text: These boots look like the old standard European hiking boots I've worn for years, but they are too narrow. The toe box is tapered, something inconsistent with a boot made to be worn with hiking socks and prolonged walking. I'll keep them, but my old discontinued Cabela's hikers will be resoled and continue to be my go to hikers. The insert is cheap plastic and also too narrow. I replaced it with a Birkenstock half insole.
customer_reviews.author: Loon Watcher

customer_reviews.title: They are fairly heavy and obviously nice construction. What's kind of weird though is the ...
customer_reviews.text: These boots are warmer than I am used to with my usual boot being a desert boot. They are fairly heavy and obviously nice construction. What's kind of weird though is the lack of insole. It seems that there is ample space to add an aftermarket insole and wear thicker socks if needs be. I love that they are made in America and the cool vintage nostalgia about them. That said, these are city boots for me. I didn't buy them to go tear them up in the muck.
customer_reviews.author: David Glass

customer_reviews.title: Heirloom Quality!
customer_reviews.text: The best boots I've ever owned and held in person. The quality is absolutley perfect. Except for one pet peeve of mine, the tongue. It moves to one side. Other than that the leather is amazing along with the classic vibram sole. The look is rugged but clean. Beware of the break in period. It take roughly a month for them to break in but once they do, they literally fit like a glove. If you have the money by these. You wont regret it. Oil these bad boys once a month and they will last you a lifetime!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, runs large
customer_reviews.text: I have wide feet and needed to order the 2E width. They tend to run narrow, but for length sizing they run large. I normally would wear a 10.5, but for these a I am wearing a 10 and they are still on the bigger side, but 9.5 would be too small. I would suggest ordering half a size down from your normal size and a wide if you have wide feet. Super comfortable for all day use and good quality. Made in Usa. The tongue can slip to one side a little bit, but it's not really an issue. My only complaint is they tend to be a little warm for non-cold climate use.
customer_reviews.author: Tech person123

customer_reviews.title: A most excellent boot!!
customer_reviews.text: The last boot I bought was a Vasque and it lasted me 10 years with minimal to average use. This boot I bought because at 66 years old, it's probably my last boot. If it lasts me the rest of my days, I'm a happy guy. Initial fit was good with room for extra socks. I wore them all day at home for the out of the box experience and it was a good day. They came with an "Airthotic" insert that fits under the heel and arch. It promotes circulation to keep your feet from getting hot or damp. Great idea.
customer_reviews.author: Hosehead

customer_reviews.title: Solid boots but require break in
customer_reviews.text: Have only worn these boots for a little bit, first impression is they are a super well made solid boot. But wear double socks- that heel will give you a blister on your achilles for sure! But I can tell after these boots break in they will be amazing. Will try to post an update in a few months. Also, buy through amazon if you get the chance, much faster and better C.S. than other sellers (plus I got a 20% discount for black friday that other sellers weren't doing, so was cheapest option)...
customer_reviews.author: B.A.R.27

customer_reviews.title: Way too narrow.
customer_reviews.text: Never had a D width shoe that was so narrow, including other Danner brand boots. It was actually a joke. Danner needs to change their sizing chart for this particular style. I have reordered a 2EE and am worried that won't even be wide enough.
customer_reviews.author: David Keith

customer_reviews.title: Having owned several Danner boots I was very disappointed with these
customer_reviews.text: Having owned several Danner boots I was very disappointed with these. The tongue makes it so there is pressure on the top of my foot causing extreme discomfort. Ended up returning them.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Von Roch

customer_reviews.title: In Danner boots I always need to go up 1/2 size larger than my usual size.
customer_reviews.text: 75% Of the time I wear a 10.5 regular in footwear. I’ve had several different Danner boots over the years and with this brand I always need 11 regular. Ordered 11 reg in the Mountain Light II and the fit is good. The width may be slightly on the narrow side which is pretty normal for the Danner boots I’ve had. Not at all uncomfortable as is and will break in nicely to a perfect fitting boot. These boots are very well made and should last a lifetime if cared for.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: They fit perfectly and are extremely comfortable for the first day
customer_reviews.text: I've worn them all day. There's a little discomfort with stiffness which is expected in any quality leather boot. They fit perfectly and are extremely comfortable for the first day. I'll be wearing them in several types of wilderness, woodland, wetlands, rocky terrain, and urban settings, to name a few in the coming month and will update after the test. UPDATE, it's been 4 months and I am greatly impressed with these boots. I've been climbing mountains 6 days a week for the last 3 months and their support and comfort exceeded my expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas G.

customer_reviews.title: Great boot
customer_reviews.text: Fit just right if not little big. Went wide to take account bigger socks and my issue with shoes is usually narrow so this one was perfect. At first thought loose because still different fitting from mountain 600 but I think just getting used to the heavier weight more than anything. Very happy so far does need break in period.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: Rugged AND Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair....great boot. Anyone who truly works in boots daily knows they aren't going to last forever BUT these are rugged boots. As an arborist I love them for climbing. Excellent traction and not too heavy. I prefer boot that doesn't come up too high on the ankle. As far as comfort goes I wish my lifestyle would allow me to hike the Appalachian Trail. These would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Aggieclimber

customer_reviews.title: size down 1/2 size from Brannock Device Size
customer_reviews.text: I measure a 10D on a Brannock device. I wear 10D in Allen Edmonds. I wear 9.5D in Wolverine 1000 Miles and in Clark's Desert Boots. I went with a 9.5D in these boots and they fit perfectly. I just received the boots and haven't really gotten to test them but I can tell they are well made like tanks.
customer_reviews.author: Anon

customer_reviews.title: I'm delighted to find that they're much lighter than expected
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift, so I've not yet hiked in them. In wearing them around the house, they seem to fit perfectly. I'm delighted to find that they're much lighter than expected. The construction appears to be top quality. I'm a retired park ranger who has been hiking for more than 50 years and have worn out many hiking boots, but I have high expectations that these may turn out to be the best hiking boots I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Swartz

customer_reviews.title: The perfect boot
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots. Still breaking them in a bit but so far so good. Put a coat of Danner Clear boot dressing on them right away. Had them out twice in some serious snow. No water inside.
customer_reviews.author: Fishin Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great Boot
customer_reviews.text: A great American made boot. Sizing is accurate and fit is great. These, as noted are extremely stiff and will take time to break in. Good socks and the boot cream help. Right boot rubbed in back but lacing them tight obviously helps. Patience is a must. All aspects of the boots are well made and constructed
customer_reviews.author: Cover 6

customer_reviews.title: Old school cool
customer_reviews.text: I really like these after two weeks. Very comfy....nice fit.....I've been sloshing through snow and sleet and feet stay dry. I applied a little sno seal and it seems to make the water bead off easily enough. I really like the style most of all....paired with jeans and a flanel shirt instant classic! I never thought I would spend this much on boots but now I realize why buy $100 boots every winter when I could have just bought these. Made in america with a recraftable option. I see these things lasting a LONG time. The leather is thick and stitching is top notch. GO USA MADE!
customer_reviews.author: M. Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Made in USA!!!
customer_reviews.text: Made in USA! Workmanship, assembly and finish were excellent. Just starting to break them in, so far so good. Only complaint, boots did not come with insoles, would think a pair of boots in this price range would have them for sure. However they did come with a nifty pair of arch supports. I did end up getting a pair of insoles for them.
customer_reviews.author: StuckinCalifornia

customer_reviews.title: Nice Boots
customer_reviews.text: I think that these are some of the nicest most comfortable outdoor boots I have purchased however they are not waterproof in the snow as ice will get down the side of the tongue. Overall good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Niven

customer_reviews.title: Buy the right size the first time
customer_reviews.text: These are probably an amazing boot but I won't be able to wear them. So this review is really about the customer service when you buy Danner boots on Amazon. I purchased these boots a half size smaller than I usually wear and they were still to big. Neither Danner or Amazon would allow me to exchange them for a smaller size. Since I bought them on sale I won't be able to buy another pair. Be careful when you select your size there are no exchanges!
customer_reviews.author: Josh Davis

customer_reviews.title: Solid and well made
customer_reviews.text: These boots are top quality and good looking. I needed them for snow travel, and the substantial sole was non-slip while the and leather-work did a fine job keeping out the wet and cold. I've always used 10.5 wide with a pair of good wool socks, but not with these boots.....they were uncomfortably tight in the area of the toe, just where you can't do much to stretch them. I've had to wear light socks to fit....that really defeated my enthusiasm for these boots.....I've already had to go elsewhere for comfortable replacements.
customer_reviews.author: GZP

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots, love them!
customer_reviews.text: Wow, just wow. These boots are a great product. Made well and the break in period is going better that expected. I am using mink oil and Danner's Black Boot Dressing. It’s been over a year and these boots are holding up great. The soles are showing a bit of wear but that’s to be expected with how often I wear these. I’ve added arch support and if there was one thing I wish dinner would do, it would be to provide better support inside the boot. I’ve been to 27 states wearing these and my goal is 50. Great boots!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Old world craftmanship. Made in the USA
customer_reviews.text: Danner, one of the very best shoe/boot manufacturers that you can find on the planet. Made in the USA . Believe it, you get what you pay for! Best pair of boots I've ever owned, in all respects. Materials, craftsmanship, fit and comfort, company support with re-craftable boots for a life time of service
customer_reviews.author: mark tibolla

customer_reviews.title: and they fit great. Only minor thing would be that the tongue ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordering online can be a bit “iffy” when it has to do sizes and fit. I was very hopeful ordering these boots. And it payed off. Quality boots for sure. I have a wide foot, size 12 normally. I ordered a 12EE, and they fit great. Only minor thing would be that the tongue folds up a bit inside the boot. But it’s not critical. Awesome boots! I’m happy with them for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Erik Boie

customer_reviews.title: Men's 10.5 EE
customer_reviews.text: Love them, virtually no break in time. -roomy toe box, comfortable heel box. - awesome tread pattern and soles in general, stiff but not obnoxiously so. Laces sucked, probably my only complaint. Easily fixed.
customer_reviews.author: MK-

customer_reviews.title: Horrible Fit.  No Customer Service.
customer_reviews.text: Very tough to break in, even after two months of daily wear. Gave up and tried to give them away online. No takers. Donated to the Viet Vets org.
customer_reviews.author: Tpr. Joe

customer_reviews.title: Just Buy Now
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing Danners for over 20 years. I have Acadias, Ft. Lewis, Desert Boots, Recon, Patrol, and a pair of the brown Mountain Light II's. I still have every pair except the brown Mountain Light II. The Mountain Light II runs 1 size smaller than their other models. The leather is incredibly soft, I have only worn these for a three mile walk, but they are comfortable right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Marc B

customer_reviews.title: Get them bought!
customer_reviews.text: Best boots ever owned. As I spend a lot of the time in the U.K., and as I was tired of packing my boots every time I travelled (plus I was tight on luggage weight last time I was flying back) I bought a second pair for here in the US. I knew exactly what I was getting and I’m not disappointed. I’d actually say they were underpriced when compared to Danner’s slightly cheaper range of boots.
customer_reviews.author: Scott L.

customer_reviews.title: I hope they make these until I die!
customer_reviews.text: Blocky, but a lot lighter than they look. I had to put inserts in them because I stand on concrete a lot. Extremely well made. I have a difficult time finding shoes that fit, because I have short, "Fred Flintstone" feet. These were the width and length they said they would be, and Amazon sells them for far less than the Danner website. Made in USA. I used to buy Red Wings, but too many of the pairs I like from their catalog are made overseas, and are not much less expensive than these boots.
customer_reviews.author: J.M. Romero

customer_reviews.title: Great treat for the feet
customer_reviews.text: I researched a long time and looked at a lot of brands before I decided on these Danner's. It is high in price but definitely worth the expense. These were my criteria. Could the boots be resoled and restored? Was it available in my size with a wide foot? Was it black? Were they full leather uppers? The Vibram sole is a plus, but a big plus. It added has added width in the sole for more stability. Although they mightbbe heavy for high altitude rock climbers, for the kind of walking I like to do theybare very supportive. The full welt doubles over for extra cushioning of a high instep, particularly if feet swell after a long day.
customer_reviews.author: Sipherkid

customer_reviews.title: good boots
customer_reviews.text: Nice well made pair of boots. Interesting color. Fit was almost perfect. It was a little narrow when first tried on. They started stretching after a days wear. Width is close to perfect now. The reason I said somewhat large is because the boot had too much volume for my foot. Solve it with a good insert. I expect many years of comfortable service with these boots. Great timely service.
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: not womens
customer_reviews.text: Shown as a women's size 10, mens size 10 was sent and t he size i need is $100.00 more
customer_reviews.author: Maria

customer_reviews.title: Size matching and comfort
customer_reviews.text: I deliberated about it, especially after reading comments pertaining size issues. Having very (!) wide feet with a very high instep I was a bit hesitant at first. It was a perfect fit. The boot opens much like a clamshell with a vast adjustment due to it's clever design/construction of the tongue. Extremely light and effectively very comfortable. Highly recommended for the wide foot person. EE, size 11.
customer_reviews.author: Tomasz Lebecki

customer_reviews.title: Still the same awesome quality I have known from Danner for many
customer_reviews.text: Still the same awesome quality I have known from Danner for many, many years - unlike other brands that have moved their manufacturing to China, these are still made in the USA and awesome. Love these.
customer_reviews.author: Ignatius Reilly

customer_reviews.title: These boots are amazing. I wear them everyday
customer_reviews.text: These boots are amazing. I wear them everyday, they are my main shoe. I ordered both the 9.0 and 9.5, intending to return one of them. The 9.0 fit best (which is my size generally). Only thing I don't like are the green laces. I wish Danner offered a pair of flat, brown laces that would fit this boot. I couldn't find that anywhere so I replaced them with brown standard boot laces.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel O.

customer_reviews.title: The quality is excellent I have returned the boots and ordered a 9 ...
customer_reviews.text: I read the review’s and the common theme was they fit small , I went one size larger than my regular hiking boot fit and ordered a 10EE. When the boots arrived I had over a centimeter space at the heel and the size corresponded exactly with a 10 . The quality is excellent I have returned the boots and ordered a 9 EE , looking forward to taking them to the forest this weekend. I can only think the reviewers were referring to the size D.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Superb quality and fit
customer_reviews.text: I bought these and took them right out of the box and put them on. Not even broken in for a day, I took them to France as my only pair of shoes. I have been averaging 6-7 miles per day walking and upwards of 60 flights of stairs. They have left my feet feeling pain free and blister free. Plus the looks I get from Parisians, a combination of cool and rugged. You can't go wrong with an investment in these Danner Boots.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Hall

customer_reviews.title: A little disappointed with my first pair of Danner's
customer_reviews.text: I wear these boots everyday for work and they aren't that comfortable for me. I've used them on several long hiking/backpacking trips and my feet always ended up raw. I think the plastic arch insert that comes with them caused much of my pain. I will be using some other type of boot inserts even though Danner doesn't suggest it. After wearing them for the first time I noticed the leather gets scuffed very easily. My boots are supposed to look good and be polished for my job, it makes it hard when I have to tip toe around to ensure I don't scuff them.
customer_reviews.author: NSB

customer_reviews.title: Toes crushers
customer_reviews.text: Not really sure how many stars to give as they seem high quality and fit well but unfortunately have a fatal flaw. Because the tongue and laces go down the foot further they make the boot bend in a kinda weird place and this forces all the folded leather from the tongue to crush your toes. I literally cant take a single normal step in them out of fear of amputation.
customer_reviews.author: Tyson Richmond

customer_reviews.title: No fuss break in period
customer_reviews.text: Great feeling and comfortable for a work boot. The leather is perfect and these are a sharp looking field boot. I will buy again
customer_reviews.author: The Lad

customer_reviews.title: A+
customer_reviews.text: Very good product. Don't forget to order your boot oil to prolong life of the boots and help with the break In process. I used neetsfoot oil.
customer_reviews.author: Jim / Madison MS.

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: 2 plus years of use, not daily but ofter, have done day hikes as well as knocking around town, still look good and wearing very well. I do use Superfeet insoles in all my shoes but these are intrinsictly comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Seattle Mike

customer_reviews.title: Well built, nice finish, made in the USA
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Really happy with the construction and finish. Good to know these are made in the USA and should I want I can get them re-soled. They are bigger in the toe-box than the external appearance would lead you to believe - that's good for me. They are comfortable out of the box, but I did add my own insoles and could use a slight stretch in the achllies area - a common issue for me.
customer_reviews.author: LA

customer_reviews.title: These boots are better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: These boots are better than I expected. From the reviews I assumed they would be really stiff, but they are fairly comfortable right out of the box. **Key Note** The price of these boots change quite frequently,so keep an eye out because one day they can be $230, one day they can be $260, and then a week later they can be $210.
customer_reviews.author: JakeDEG

customer_reviews.title: Boots are comfortable, I wear them hiking and scrambling rocks
customer_reviews.text: Boots are comfortable, I wear them hiking and scrambling rocks. Very lite. I do fell they need a better foot bed inside. They are a little wide. They don't have great ankle support. I rolled my foot and sprained my ankle the first time out, not a pleasant trip to have to climb up another 800' and walk miles back to the car. Now I am more conscious of it and tie them tightly and am more careful with foot placement.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Clune

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT feel good on the feet.
customer_reviews.text: For something designed for hiking these boots are uncomfortable. The heel lip has eaten into my achilles tendon. The uppler lip where the laces are uncomfortable. You'd think a boot for this price would: 1: Feel good and easy on your feet 2: Would be designed NOT to rip your feet to shreds 3: Be designed for long term usage Conclusion: Pro: Good leather. Cons: Over priced, poorly designed and painful.
customer_reviews.author: Charley DoGood

customer_reviews.title: Danner Rocks
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair of Danner Boots I also own the Quarry Boots, I needed a black pair of boots so my wife said. That gave me the opportunity to add yet another quality boot to my arsenal! Fit, comfort, style, are all second to none. I am in my mid 40's and have purchased many boots in my lifetime, trust me when I tell you if you, spend a little more for your boots and you will not be disappointed! I have lower back pain when I wear cheap boots. I do not have that pain in these boots. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Eracer8

customer_reviews.title: Loved every pair of these I've owned
customer_reviews.text: Loved every pair of these I've owned. First pair of these lasted me 10 years. Had them resoled once during that time. 2nd pair has been to Moscow in Jan. and Thailand during the monsoon season. Comfortable always. This is the 3rd pair because I wanted some in black. Just buy them.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley Fields

customer_reviews.title: Great boots! Kinda heavy and you better order the wider size.
customer_reviews.text: Heavier than I thought (they are call mountain light.) I'm definitely glad I ordered the wide because these boots would be too narrow otherwise. They are very well built, have a relatively short break in period and I'm sure they'll last a very long time.
customer_reviews.author: john wilson

customer_reviews.title: comfortable boots. Break in period not nearly as bad ...
customer_reviews.text: Handsome, well-built, classically-styled, and most importantly, comfortable boots. Break in period not nearly as bad as some make it out to be. About a week of indoor wear of work was all that was required. Will require insole as others explained. Get 0.5 size down and EE width. Can't go wrong. Made in USA. Way to go, Danner!
customer_reviews.author: PostScriptReviewer

customer_reviews.title: Best boots ever
customer_reviews.text: Best boots ever...my old pair is still going, after five years of heavy use...they're going to the farm, and these are my new "dress-ups"! So comfortable and such great quality. Thanks a lot!
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Great boot for work or hunting
customer_reviews.text: Bought the same size as what I've always bought in the rainforest. Perfect fit. Great boot for walking, work, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Nice, well made boots
customer_reviews.text: Nice, well made boots. The width seems a bit snug but I have only been wearing them for 5 days. I wear them all day for working, walking and anything else that comes along. I understand that these take a couple of weeks to fully break in so, so far so good. The soles give great lateral stability. I would give 5 stars but I have not had them long enough. Will update later.
customer_reviews.author: HSS

customer_reviews.title: Rubs my ankles into painful blisters
customer_reviews.text: Despite my best efforts to break these in, I have found - like other wearers - that these boots rub my ankles extensively. Even with blister protectors on my ankles, they cause painful blisters to appear. For that reason, I cannot recommend these for anyone.
customer_reviews.author: A. Marks

customer_reviews.title: Not perfect...for the price
customer_reviews.text: There is some sort of lump under the ball of my left foot...it may be from the center-lined stitching in the arch support. VERY distracting. At first, I thought my sock bunched-up on me somehow. I keep wanting to take my boot off and dump out a penny.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: Two pairs returned because of defects !
customer_reviews.text: Sadly I have had to return two pairs because of manufacturing defects. Here's to hoping the 3rd pair will be perfect! Awesome quality except for what seems to be a folded piece of the toe cap inside the right boot which creates a big lump just next to the big toe - can't really wear them because of that. FYI I am replacing a pair that is 30 years old, the shank finally seems to have pushed through inside the boot.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Duncan A. Groenewald

customer_reviews.title: give it some time!
customer_reviews.text: first time i put on this boot,it feeled bad ,the leather was very hard and totally uncomfortable. After a week of running in,it has changed a lot and the leather began to soften,i feels great! About the size,it's just the same as NIKE,I am Asian. Remember, at the beginning of the running-in time, please wear thick socks
customer_reviews.author: JINGZHANG

customer_reviews.title: Danner mountain light II
customer_reviews.text: Boots are a little tough to break in but nothing terrible. Did not come with the danner airthotic insole like the description said. So far I am loving them all in all! Update: 2 weeks later they are breaking in nicely! Emailed the seller and told them they did not come with the insoles and they sent a pair no questions asked! Very pleased with the boots and the service!
customer_reviews.author: Cole S.

customer_reviews.title: Poor tongue design.
customer_reviews.text: The tongue design is poor. When you fold over the tongue this creates pressure points. I would never use these an a hike.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbosocal

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed. Not worth the large amount of money to put down for this boot. Very little ankle support and doc martens feel, not made for hiking in my opinion. Would keep for style only, not for hiking. Flawed design as back part of boot digs into Achilles. Seen better quality at a third of the cost. I will return this boot.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great boot--break them in!!
customer_reviews.text: Great looking boot--seem well made and hopefully will last a long time. Give them time to break in and work with the tongue system to get them to stay centered. You'll get the payoff. Classic looks and good enough to wear in the mud/climbing as well as on the city streets during the winter. I tried some engineer boots but these have a better look and feel overall and do the same thing.....
customer_reviews.author: Hawk BB Fan

customer_reviews.title: They are very comfortable and I hope they are durable
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing the boots since they arrived last Tuesday. They are very comfortable and I hope they are durable. I bought these specifically because the sole is sewn on. My cobbler won't repair boots that are glued together and come apart.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great boot.  Maybe narrow???
customer_reviews.text: I love the boots and they are the quality I would expect from Danner. My only issue is the width. I have always worn standard width shows and the Danner sizing chart recommended standard width as well. The mountain lights seem to run narrow in the toe box. That is the only reason I did not rate 5 star. I will keep the boots, but will try a wider width if purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: ad t

customer_reviews.title: Another GREAT Danner Product
customer_reviews.text: Another great product by Danner. Solidly built, yet light and comfortable. The leather scuffs easily so be prepared to take good care of it. Polish, seal and maintain and this will last a long time. The one little complaint I have is that they could send this boot out with better laces. The ones that come with it untie themselves constantly. For a boot this nice ... I would sell them with waxed laces or laces that simply stay tied!!
customer_reviews.author: P. F. Gilbert

customer_reviews.title: Overall excellent boot
customer_reviews.text: Fit as expected. The sole and upper are simply outstanding. I’m having some issues with the tongue and coverage design and the upper ankle fit is slightly loose; but the boot as a whole is excellent. I very strongly recommend the Danner inserts and boot dressing.
customer_reviews.author: RUDY WYLAND

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: Had these for about a month. Price was better than anywhere else I looked. Break-in was fairly easy and short (x2 all-day wears). Leather is high-quality. Gore-Tex liner serves well (if a bit warm). Boots come with a footbed (heel and arch only) which worked out for me. I usually use superfeet, but these crowded the toebox a bit too much, so the ones they came with are working really well. Tread is good, soft but not wearing too quickly. Laces fray quickly at hook points, so I advise picking up an extra pair.
customer_reviews.author: JKMWest

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are surprisingly comfortable for the type of boot that it is. I know that they will become more comfortable as they break in and the leather conforms to my foot. I expect to have these boots for a long time so the 200 dollar price tag is definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: jesse

customer_reviews.title: Replace Every Qtr Century
customer_reviews.text: My first pair of these was purchased in 1994. 24 years later it was time for my second pair. Make sure you add the plastic heal cup for an improved fit. These boots are the real deal. Solid and comfortable. They provide maximum support and stability for hiking with a full pack.
customer_reviews.author: Red Rubicon

customer_reviews.title: I love these hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: I love these hiking boots. I was a bit concerned of the break-in period reading other comments, but I would say that they are very comfortable! Of course you couldn't expect to wear them for a long hike (days) without a break-in period, but I wore them for a 3 hours hike on rocky trails the very first day, without blisters or any problem. They are not too heavy and support quite well my ankles. Very happy with them
customer_reviews.author: KarstKeiler

customer_reviews.title: Really well built boots
customer_reviews.text: I wore Danner boots first in the army and loved them. They held up to tons of miles and were very comfortable. I’m just breaking these in, but am already impressed by to comfort and solid build. Hoping they have many years in them.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki

customer_reviews.title: Good boot
customer_reviews.text: I'm not qualified to rate this since I haven't worn boots in over 30 years so consider the source. I had some Achilles rub on one foot that requires may to tape up my feet. I assume my feet will toughen up or the shoe will break in. I consider this to be the cost of buying a boot that will last forever. Other boots may break in quicker simply because they are made from more pliable leather bit it's the hard leather that makes Danner boots last a lifetime.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: two star for fit, five for quality
customer_reviews.text: If you have wide foot, these are not for you. Though a nice boot, and obviously well constructed, they are for people with narrow feet; so, a wide is more like a "D" rather than a true wide. If you look at the fine print on Danner's own website, under what they term last (a technical sizing term), you'll see that's exactly what they say about the 650ee. So, I can give neither a positive nor negative recommendation. Had these boots fit, they would get a five star.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy P Dugan

product_meta.title: Danner Mens 30860-M Mountain Light Ii 5"
product_meta.description:
'EGENDARY AMONG HIKERS AND BACKPACKERS WORLDWIDE

The USA-made Mountain Light hiking boot is legendary for its unmatched quality, durability and support. GORE-TEX lining provides waterproof protection. The Vibram Kletterlift outsole offers lightweight comfort as well as superb shock absorption and guarantees great traction and stability on both wet and dry surfaces. Danner’s famous stitchdown construction provides a wider platform for stability and the lace-to-toe system provides a secure fit.
feature_bullets: Danner Airthotic heel cradle and arch support
Handcrafted, stitchdown construction for strength and stability. Fiberglass shank.
Vibram 148 Kletterlift outsole offers superior traction, stability and shock absorption on rugged terrain
